eu.mf2c.security.ac

Class MsgTokenBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.mf2c.security.ac.MsgTokenBuilder

  • public class MsgTokenBuilder
extends Object
    Use this to build the appropriate type of message token.

    author Shirley Crompton email shirley.crompton@stfc.ac.uk org Data Science and Technology Group, UKRI Science and Technology Council Created 8 Mar 2019

        public MsgTokenBuilder setRecipients(String... recipients)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Set recipients.

        Parameters:
        recipients - one or more recipient device IDs.
        Returns:
        the same MsgTokenBuilder object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no recipient is provided

      • setSecPolicy

        public MsgTokenBuilder setSecPolicy(Security sec)
        Set the Security policy applicable. The policy determines what sort of token would be returned:
        • public : a token that is neither signed nor encrypted
        • protected : a token that is signed with the private key of the sender
        • private : a token with a payload that is encrypted using an AEAD algorithm (AES-GSM 256) and a generated symmetric key. The symmetric key is encrypted per recipient with the recipient's public key. Additional associated data is integrity protected as part of the protected header.

        Parameters:
        sec - the security policy to apply to the token
        Returns:
        the same MsgTokenBuilder object.

      • setTyp

        public MsgTokenBuilder setTyp(Type typ)

      • setEnableCompression

        public MsgTokenBuilder setEnableCompression(boolean compFlag)
        Set the payload compression flag

        Parameters:
        compFlag - enable payload compression if fag is set to true, default is false.
        Returns:
        the same MsgTokenBuilder object.

      • setMsgPayload

        public MsgTokenBuilder setMsgPayload(String payload)
        Set the payload content

        Parameters:
        payload - the content String
        Returns:
        the same MsgTokenBuilder object.

      • build

        public String build()
             throws MsgTokenBuilderException
        Build the required message token as per the security policy. The recipients and security policy are mandatory attributes that must be set before calling the build method. Also do not reuse the builder to build a different token as the attributes would not have been reinitialised.

        Returns:
        the token string
        Throws:
        MsgTokenBuilderException - if there is an error

      • buildJWT

        public String buildJWT()
                throws MsgTokenBuilderException
        Build a signed JWT to assert the Agent's identity to support inter-Agent communication
        Returns:
        a String representation of the JWT
        Throws:
        MsgTokenBuilderException - on errors
